text.section: A person is guilty of misapplication of entrusted property when he applies or disposes of property that has been entrusted to him as a fiduciary, or property of the government or of a financial institution in a manner which he knows is unauthorized and involves substantial risk of loss or detriment to the owner of the property or to a person for whose benefit the property was entrusted.
Misapplication of entrusted property is a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 155, effective January 1, 1975.
